meanings.definition: A person or thing that spanks.
meanings.sent1: The spanker gently scolded the naughty child for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: My mom is the designated spanker in our family when we misbehave.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy saw the spanker and quickly hid under the table.
meanings.sent4: The spanker of the group, Sarah always kept everyone in line with her firm but fair discipline.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden spoon became the symbol of the spanker in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A fore-and-aft sail set on the aftermost lower mast of a square-rigged ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors hoisted the spanker to catch the wind and propel the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to adjust the spanker to navigate through the rough seas.
meanings.sent3: As the storm approached, the spanker flapped wildly in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: The spanker billowed like a giant white wing against the blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to raise the spanker and guide the ship safely to shore.
